metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11727 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability exists where it possible to force Network Security Services (NSS) to sign CertificateVerify with PKCS#1 v1.5 signatures when those are the only ones advertised by server in CertificateRequest in TLS 1.3. PKCS#1 v1.5 signatures should not be used for TLS 1.3 messages. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 68.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11727` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> only an issue with TLSv1.3. Releases before Bionic have no TLSv1.3 support. Bionic shipped with an incompatible TLSv1.3 draft, so likely not used.

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
